Complete mastery of transitions and continuity ensures zero breaks in flow under any conditions, even during the most demanding choreography. Exceptional coordination creates the continuous, flowing quality that distinguishes skilled performers and captivates audiences. Every element integrates into unified, cohesive artistic vision characteristic of Open Championship performance. Perfect flow and continuity contribute significantly to overall performance quality and competitive impact, demonstrating the complete control and seamless execution expected at the world stage.

skills.name: Stage Presence
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer is developing confidence and stage presence, often appearing tentative or uncertain when performing. Energy projection is limited, with dancer focusing primarily on remembering choreography and executing basic technique. Connection with audience or adjudicators is minimal as attention is directed inward to technical execution. May appear nervous, self-conscious, or uncomfortable on stage. Use of performance space is basic, remaining mostly in center stage without purposeful movement around the space. Walk-on and walk-off lack confidence and presence. Understanding that stage presence is a developable skill is emerging. Focus is appropriately on building technical foundation and basic performance comfort. Stage presence will develop gradually with increased technical confidence, performance experience, and dedicated practice of performance skills.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved stage presence with developing confidence during familiar routines. Energy projection is better during well-rehearsed choreography, showing emerging performance quality. Beginning to project outward toward adjudicators and audience rather than maintaining completely internal focus. Facial expression and eye engagement are developing. Walk-on and walk-off show improved confidence though still developing. Better use of stage space in practiced routines. Can demonstrate adequate stage presence during grade examinations and single dance performances at early competitive levels. Stage presence is emerging as separate skill from pure technical execution. Still appears somewhat tentative during challenging sections or when performing new choreography. Adequate presence for Advanced Beginner and early Novice levels where performance skills are developing.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer maintains good stage presence consistently throughout competition routines at regional feiseanna. Confident demeanor is evident on stage with solid energy projection throughout performance. Clear connection with adjudicators and audience shows purposeful outward projection of performance. Eyes are open, active, and present with forward gaze that engages observers. Good use of entire stage demonstrates ownership of performance space. Walk-on and walk-off are confident and poised with understanding that performance begins before dancing starts and continues after. Facial expression matches performance energy appropriately. Stage presence enhances technical presentation, creating engaging performances. This level of confident performance quality is competitive at Novice and Prizewinner levels, beginning to distinguish dancers beyond pure technical capability.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent stage presence at all times during championship competition, projecting commanding energy and confidence throughout preliminary championship routines. Confident demeanor and powerful presence create strong connection with adjudicators and audience. Eyes project performance with purpose, smile and facial expression enhance presentation, and posture communicates ownership of stage. Uses entire stage confidently and purposefully, projecting performance outward with eyes, smile, posture, and attack. Walk-on and walk-off demonstrate complete confidence and professional presence. Stage presence becomes competitive strength that enhances technical excellence, creating electrifying performances. The further outward dancer projects with eyes, smile, posture, and energy, the bigger and more compelling the performance. This exceptional stage presence is essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class stage presence that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Commanding presence captivates audiences and adjudicators throughout all routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships. Exceptional energy, confidence, and charisma create electrifying performances that distinguish dancer among elite competitors. Complete mastery of performance projection with powerful use of eyes, facial expression, posture, and stage space creates signature commanding presence. Perfect confidence from walk-on through walk-off demonstrates complete comfort and ownership of world stage. Stage presence becomes defining characteristic that elevates technical and artistic excellence, creating the compelling, memorable performances that define Open Championship competition. Exceptional stage presence contributes significantly to competitive success at the world stage.

skills.name: Facial Expression
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates limited facial expression and eye engagement while performing, often with neutral, blank, or uncertain expression. May look down at feet frequently, breaking eye engagement with adjudicators and audience. Eyes may appear unfocused, uncertain, or wandering as dancer concentrates on remembering choreography and executing technique. Smile is absent or appears forced and unnatural. Facial expression does not match or enhance performance energy. Limited awareness of importance of facial expression to overall presentation. Focus is appropriately on learning choreography and fundamental technique. Understanding that eyes should be open, active, and present is developing. Facial expression and eye engagement will improve as technical confidence grows and dancer can shift attention to performance aspects.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved facial expression with eyes forward more consistently during familiar routines. Smile is developing and appears more natural in well-rehearsed choreography. Eyes are open and more engaged though may still wander during difficult sections or when focusing on technical execution. Facial expression is beginning to match performance quality and energy level. Better understanding of keeping eyes forward and active rather than looking down at feet. Can demonstrate reasonable facial expression during grade examinations and single dance performances. Still lacks consistent engagement and natural expression characteristic of strong performers. Adequate facial expression for Advanced Beginner and early Novice levels where performance skills are emerging alongside technical development.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer maintains good facial expression and eye engagement consistently throughout competition routines at regional feiseanna. Eyes are open, active, and present with forward and outward gaze that engages adjudicators effectively. Appropriate smile enhances performance without appearing forced or artificial. Facial expression matches and supports performance energy, contributing to engaging overall presentation. Never looks down at feet, maintaining confident forward gaze throughout all movements. Expression remains consistent during both simple and complex choreography. Understanding of facial expression as important performance element is evident in purposeful engagement. This level of facial expression enhances technical presentation and contributes to overall performance quality competitive at Novice and Prizewinner levels in regional competition.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent facial expression and eye engagement at all times during championship competition. Perfect eye engagement is maintained throughout preliminary championship routines—eyes are always open, active, and present, powerfully connecting with adjudicators. Smile and facial expression appropriately enhance performance quality, appearing natural and confident rather than forced. Expression matches performance energy perfectly, contributing to compelling overall presentation. Forward and outward gaze never breaks regardless of choreographic complexity or physical demands. Facial expression becomes strength that enhances stage presence and technical execution. Quality of eye engagement and expression contributes significantly to electrifying performance presence. This exceptional facial expression and engagement is essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class facial expression and eye engagement that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Perfect facial expression and powerful eye engagement create captivating performances throughout all routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships. Eyes are consistently open, active, and present with commanding gaze that powerfully connects with adjudicators and audiences. Exceptional smile and expression enhance performance without ever appearing artificial, contributing significantly to overall artistic quality. Complete mastery of performance projection through eyes and facial expression creates signature commanding presence characteristic of Open Championship performance. Perfect engagement demonstrates the complete performance confidence and professional presence expected at the world stage.

skills.name: Performance Quality
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates basic performance delivery with primary focus on technical execution and remembering choreography. Energy level is developing but often appears low or inconsistent, particularly as routine progresses or when executing challenging movements. Commitment to performance aspect is emerging but overshadowed by technical concentration. Presentation is basic with limited polish or professional quality. Performance energy does not yet remain consistent from start to finish of routine. Understanding of performance quality as separate from pure technical execution is developing. Focus is appropriately on building technical foundation and basic performance comfort. Performance quality will develop as technical confidence increases and dancer can allocate attention to delivery, energy maintenance, and overall presentation beyond just executing steps correctly.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved performance quality with better energy delivery during familiar routines. Energy level is higher and more consistent in well-rehearsed choreography, showing developing commitment to performance aspect. Performance delivery shows improvement from start to finish during single dance presentations. Better balance emerging between technical focus and performance quality. Can demonstrate adequate performance energy during grade examinations and early competitive performances. Still experiences energy drops during challenging sections, when fatigued, or when performing new choreography. Professional presentation is developing but not yet consistent. Adequate performance quality for Advanced Beginner and early Novice levels where delivery skills are emerging alongside technical development. Practicing performance energy in class helps prepare for actual competition settings.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer maintains good performance quality consistently throughout competition routines at regional feiseanna. Energy level is high and sustained from start to finish of routines, showing strong commitment and engagement. Performance delivery demonstrates consistent quality across both soft shoe and hard shoe dances. Good balance between technical execution and performance energy creates engaging overall presentation. Professional quality is evident in polished delivery and sustained energy maintenance. Performance commitment is visible and consistent throughout routine duration, maintained during both simple and complex choreography. This level of performance quality enhances technical presentation, creating the engaging performances characteristic of strong competitors. Performance quality is competitive at Novice and Prizewinner levels, beginning to distinguish dancers beyond pure technical capability.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent performance quality throughout all championship competition, delivering high energy and full commitment from start to finish of preliminary championship routines. Sustained energy level never diminishes regardless of routine length, physical demands, or number of dances performed. Exceptional commitment to performance is evident in consistent quality delivery under competitive pressure at major feiseanna. Professional presentation is polished and compelling, creating performances that engage adjudicators and audiences. Performance quality is maintained consistently across multiple championship rounds and throughout competition day. High energy, full commitment, and professional delivery combine to create the compelling performances essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition. Performance quality becomes competitive strength that enhances technical excellence.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class performance quality that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Exceptional performance delivery with maximum energy and complete commitment creates captivating presentations throughout all routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships. Sustained high energy from start to finish is maintained effortlessly across multiple championship rounds regardless of physical demands or competitive pressure. Professional presentation is polished to the highest degree, creating performances that command attention and leave lasting impression. Complete commitment and exceptional energy distinguish this dancer among elite competitors with similar technical capability. Performance quality becomes defining characteristic that contributes significantly to competitive success, demonstrating the complete performance excellence expected at the world stage.

skills.name: Stamina & Endurance
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates basic fitness level appropriate for beginner routines but stamina and endurance are limited. Technical quality deteriorates noticeably as routine progresses, with visible fatigue affecting execution of steps, maintenance of posture, and overall performance energy. Physical conditioning is developing but insufficient for sustained high-intensity performance. Recovery between dances (when performing multiple dances per competition) is slow and incomplete. Understanding of Irish dancing's sprint-like energy demands (performing anaerobically at high intensity for 40-60 second bursts) is developing. Fitness requirements for explosive power, core stability, and cardiovascular endurance are being established through regular dance classes. Stamina will improve naturally with continued training and age-appropriate strength and conditioning development.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved stamina with better maintenance of technical quality through most of routine duration. Physical conditioning has developed sufficiently to support single dance performances at moderate intensity with reasonable energy maintenance. Technical quality is more consistent throughout familiar routines though still shows deterioration during challenging sections or toward end of routine. Recovery between dances is improving. Better understanding of fitness requirements for Irish dancing including explosive power, core stability, and cardiovascular endurance. Can maintain adequate performance energy during grade examinations and Advanced Beginner competition. Still developing anaerobic capacity for sustained high-intensity performance. Adequate stamina for early competitive levels with continued development needed for longer, more demanding championship routines.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer maintains good stamina consistently throughout competition routines at regional feiseanna, demonstrating adequate physical conditioning for competitive performance. Technical quality and performance energy are sustained from start to finish of routines at appropriate intensity for Novice and Prizewinner levels. Strong conditioning supports maintenance of technique, posture, and energy throughout routine duration without visible deterioration. Adequate recovery between dances allows multiple performances per competition day. Physical fitness supports explosive power for jumps, core stability for balance, and cardiovascular endurance for sustained high-intensity dancing. Understanding of Irish dancing as sprint-like anaerobic activity informs appropriate training approach. This level of stamina and endurance supports competitive performance at regional feiseanna and continued advancement to more demanding championship levels.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent stamina and endurance throughout all championship competition, maintaining perfect technical quality and high performance energy from start to finish of preliminary championship routines. Superior physical conditioning supports sustained high-intensity performance without any visible deterioration in technique, posture, or energy level. Stamina is sufficient for multiple championship-level performances per competition day with good recovery between rounds. Exceptional fitness provides explosive power for maximum jumps, core stability for perfect balance and posture, and cardiovascular endurance for extended routines. Strong anaerobic capacity allows sustained high-intensity performance at championship tempo and difficulty. Lactic acid tolerance is well-developed. This exceptional stamina is essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition where long, demanding routines must be performed at maximum intensity.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class stamina and endurance that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Exceptional physical conditioning supports effortless maintenance of perfect technical quality and maximum performance energy throughout all routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships. Superior stamina allows multiple championship rounds at highest intensity without any compromise to technique, posture, or energy regardless of routine length or difficulty. Complete fitness provides explosive power, perfect core stability, exceptional cardiovascular endurance, and elite anaerobic capacity for the sprint-like energy demands of Open Championship performance. Strong dancers last longer and dance better—this world-class stamina demonstrates the complete physical conditioning expected at the world stage, enabling sustained excellence across multiple rounds of competition at maximum difficulty.

skills.name: Trebles/Toe Technique
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer is learning basic treble technique with toe of hard shoe striking floor to create percussive sound. Execution is developing but inconsistent, with frequent unclear or imprecise toe strikes. Sound quality is variable—sometimes clear but often muffled, weak, or poorly timed. Coordination of toe strikes is challenging, particularly in combinations or rapid sequences. Understanding of trebles as fundamental hard shoe element is developing. Weight balance during toe strikes is inconsistent, affecting sound clarity and volume. Learning to create clear "click" sound from precise contact of toe tap with floor. Focus is appropriately on learning basic toe strike mechanics and building coordination. Treble technique will develop with continued practice, strength development, and refinement of precise contact timing.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved treble technique with more consistent execution during familiar hard shoe routines (Traditional Treble Jig and Traditional Hornpipe). Sound clarity has improved though still variable, with clearer "clicks" achieved more reliably in practiced sequences. Better weight balance supports crisper toe strikes with improved timing. Coordination of trebles in basic combinations is developing. Understanding of balancing volume with clarity so rhythmic pattern reads musically is emerging. Can demonstrate adequate treble technique during grade examinations and Advanced Beginner hard shoe competition. Still struggles with rapid treble combinations or complex rhythmic patterns. Adequate toe technique for early hard shoe competitive levels where foundational percussion skills are being established.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer executes trebles with good clarity and precision consistently throughout hard shoe competition routines at regional feiseanna (Treble Jig and Hornpipe). Clear, sharp toe strike sounds are produced reliably with appropriate volume for difficulty level. Precise timing of trebles creates clean rhythmic patterns that read musically. Well-balanced weight placement supports crisp execution of toe strikes in combinations and rapid sequences. Good coordination allows clean execution of complex treble patterns. Sound quality is consistent—clear "clicks" without rushing, created through precise contact of toe tap with floor. Treble technique contributes effectively to overall percussive quality of hard shoe dancing. This level of toe technique is competitive at Novice and Prizewinner levels in regional competition.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent treble technique throughout all championship hard shoe routines, with clear, sharp sounds produced consistently during preliminary championship Treble Jig and Hornpipe. Perfect clarity of toe strikes is maintained with appropriate volume throughout maximum difficulty choreography including rapid treble combinations and complex rhythmic patterns. Precise timing creates exceptional musical quality of percussion layer. Perfect weight balance supports crisp execution under all conditions. Never rushes trebles—each toe strike is clean, clear, and precisely timed. Sound quality is exemplary, demonstrating mastery of hard shoe percussion technique. This exceptional treble technique is essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition where sound quality is primary assessment criterion.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class treble technique that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Perfect toe strikes with exceptional clarity and appropriate volume are maintained throughout all hard shoe routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships. Complete mastery of treble technique creates the clear, sharp, musically precise percussion characteristic of Open Championship hard shoe performance. Every toe strike is perfectly executed with ideal clarity, volume, and timing, creating exemplary rhythmic patterns that read musically. Perfect weight balance and precise contact timing demonstrate the complete technical control expected at the world stage. Treble technique becomes signature element of hard shoe excellence.

skills.name: Stamps & Heel Clicks
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer is learning basic stamp and heel click techniques with entire foot striking floor for stamps and heels striking together for clicks. Execution is developing but inconsistent, with frequent unclear or weak sounds. Distinction between stamps and trebles is emerging but not yet reliable in execution. Heel clicks often lack clear, distinct sound or miss contact entirely. Coordination of stamps and clicks is challenging, particularly when combined with footwork or in rapid sequences. Sound quality is variable—sometimes clear but often muffled or poorly timed. Understanding of stamps and heel clicks as distinct hard shoe elements requiring full-foot contact (stamps) or heel-to-heel contact (clicks) is developing. Focus is appropriately on learning basic mechanics and building coordination. Technique will develop with continued practice and strength development.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved stamp and heel click technique with more consistent execution during familiar hard shoe routines. Sound clarity has improved with better distinction emerging between stamps (full foot) and trebles (toe only). Heel clicks are more reliable with clearer sounds produced when heels strike together. Better coordination allows execution of basic stamp and click combinations in practiced choreography. Volume and sharpness are improving though still inconsistent, particularly in rapid sequences or challenging combinations. Can demonstrate adequate stamp and heel click technique during grade examinations and Advanced Beginner hard shoe competition. Adequate technique for early hard shoe competitive levels where foundational percussion skills are being established alongside treble work.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer executes stamps and heel clicks with good clarity and precision consistently throughout hard shoe competition routines at regional feiseanna. Clear distinction between stamp sounds (full foot striking floor) and treble sounds (toe striking) is reliably maintained. Heel clicks produce clear, distinct sounds with heels striking together cleanly. Good volume and sharpness are achieved with appropriate clarity for competitive level. Rhythmic accuracy is strong in both stamp and click execution. Coordination allows clean execution of complex combinations including stamps, clicks, and trebles together. Sound quality contributes effectively to overall hard shoe rhythmic patterns and musical quality. This level of stamp and heel click technique is competitive at Novice and Prizewinner levels in regional hard shoe competition.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent stamp and heel click technique throughout all championship hard shoe routines, with clear, distinct sounds produced consistently during preliminary championship choreography. Perfect distinction between stamps, trebles, and clicks is maintained throughout maximum difficulty sequences. Heel clicks are executed with exceptional clarity and precision—heels strike together cleanly producing sharp sounds. Perfect volume and sharpness are achieved appropriate to championship difficulty level. Rhythmic accuracy is flawless in execution of all stamp and click patterns. Sound quality is exemplary, demonstrating complete mastery of hard shoe percussion elements. This exceptional stamp and heel click technique is essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition where sound quality distinguishes top competitors.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class stamp and heel click technique that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Perfect stamps and heel clicks with exceptional clarity, distinction, and appropriate volume are maintained throughout all hard shoe routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships. Complete mastery creates the clear, sharp, musically precise percussion characteristic of Open Championship hard shoe performance. Every stamp features full-foot contact with ideal sound quality; every heel click produces perfectly sharp sound from precise heel-to-heel contact. Perfect distinction between stamps, trebles, and clicks demonstrates complete technical control. Stamp and heel click technique demonstrates the complete mastery expected at the world stage.

skills.name: Rhythmic Drumming
skills.level1Descriptor: Dancer is learning to create rhythmic sounds through hard shoe work but overall rhythmic drumming quality is developing. Hard shoe percussion lacks consistent musical quality, with individual sounds (trebles, stamps, clicks) not yet forming cohesive rhythmic patterns. Balance between volume and clarity is inconsistent—sometimes too loud without clarity, other times too soft to be heard. Rhythmic patterns are unclear or muddy, lacking the crisp definition needed for musical reading. Understanding of hard shoe work as forming a percussion layer that matches the music is developing. Focus is appropriately on learning individual techniques (trebles, stamps, clicks) before integration into cohesive rhythmic drumming. Musical quality of hard shoe work will develop as individual techniques solidify and understanding of rhythmic patterns deepens.
skills.level2Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates improved rhythmic drumming quality with better integration of trebles, stamps, and clicks during familiar hard shoe routines. Individual sounds are forming more cohesive rhythmic patterns in practiced choreography, beginning to read musically. Better balance between volume and clarity is developing—patterns are more audible with improved definition. Rhythmic patterns are clearer though still inconsistent, particularly during rapid or complex sequences. Understanding of balancing volume with clarity so patterns read musically is improving. Can demonstrate adequate rhythmic drumming quality during grade examinations and Advanced Beginner hard shoe competition. Adequate for early hard shoe competitive levels where musical quality of percussion is developing alongside individual technical elements.
skills.level3Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates good rhythmic drumming quality consistently throughout hard shoe competition routines at regional feiseanna. Hard shoe percussion forms clear, musical rhythmic patterns that read effectively throughout Treble Jig and Hornpipe. Good balance of volume with clarity allows patterns to be heard and understood musically. Trebles, stamps, and heel clicks integrate cohesively, forming unified percussion layer that complements the music. Rhythmic patterns are clearly executed with appropriate variety in sound production. Musical quality of hard shoe work contributes significantly to overall performance, demonstrating understanding of hard shoe dancing as rhythmic percussion art. This level of rhythmic drumming quality is competitive at Novice and Prizewinner levels in regional hard shoe competition.
skills.level4Descriptor: Dancer exhibits excellent rhythmic drumming quality throughout all championship hard shoe routines, with exceptional musical percussion maintained during preliminary championship Treble Jig and Hornpipe. Perfect balance of volume and clarity creates rhythmic patterns that read with exceptional musical quality. Trebles, stamps, and heel clicks integrate seamlessly forming unified, musically compelling percussion layer throughout maximum difficulty choreography. Appropriate variety in sound production enhances musical interest. Rhythmic patterns are executed with perfect clarity and musical understanding, contributing significantly to overall artistic quality. Sound quality in hard shoe dancing demonstrates complete mastery of rhythmic percussion, becoming competitive strength. This exceptional rhythmic drumming is essential for success at major feiseanna and national-level championship competition.
skills.level5Descriptor: Dancer demonstrates world-class rhythmic drumming quality that exemplifies elite championship standards at international competition. Exceptional musical quality of hard shoe percussion is maintained throughout all routines at World Championships and All Ireland Championships, creating the compelling rhythmic drumming characteristic of Open Championship performance. Perfect balance of volume and clarity creates patterns that read with exceptional musical precision and artistry. Complete integration of trebles, stamps, and heel clicks forms unified percussion layer of the highest musical quality. Rhythmic patterns demonstrate complete mastery of hard shoe percussion art, contributing significantly to overall performance impact. Rhythmic drumming quality demonstrates the complete musical understanding and technical precision expected at the world stage, distinguishing medal contenders in elite hard shoe competition.
